channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: One More Level’s Valor Mortis has a new gameplay trailer
item.content:encoded:
One More Level, the development studio behind the Ghostrunner games, has released a brand new gameplay trailer for Valor Mortis. Valor Mortis is a first person soulslike, and it was annouced by the development team back in August. The new gameplay trailer, which is approximately a minute long, shows the main character William, a resurrected soldier from Napoleon’s army, using melee weapons, fire, and guns to take on all sorts of horrors.

Valor Mortis will take historical figures from Napoleon’s time and see them twisted into horrors, in a world where plague has consumed Europe but whose powers you can control. As this is a soulslike you will die over and over again in Valor Mortis, but each time you could get stronger by learning new skills and abilities, as well as working out how you need to take advantage of openings to take out the most dangerous of foes. The first playtest for Valor Mortis has concluded and that saw a culmination of 515,000 player deaths and 3 million enemy kills.

Valor Mortis is set to be released in 2026 for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.

Source: YouTube



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/23/one-more-levels-valor-mortis-has-a-new-gameplay-trailer/

item.title: Dinosaur survival FPS Ferocious is launching on December 4th
item.content:encoded:
OMYOG and tinyBuild have announced that the survival FPS filled with dinosaurs, Ferocious, will be launching on December 4th for PC via Steam. Along with the release date for Ferocious, tinyBuild has created a new trailer which shows the Dino Control Device in action. This device allows you to connect with dinosaurs to issue commands, such as attacking enemies or using them as a mount.

In Ferocious, you find yourself washed up on an island that is ruled by dinosaurs, but you soon find you are not the only person there. A group of mercenaries and their mechs are also present and they are not happy with you being on the island, so you have to survive against the dinosaurs that call the island home as well as the mercenary group. Using the dino control device, you can have the dinosaurs attack the mercenaries and destroy their outposts, but not all dinosaurs will be on your side. There are survival and crafting elements in Ferocious too, so you can create items to help with dealing with the threats the island is littered with. The PC specs are as follows:

MINIMUM:

    • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
    • OS: Windows 10/11 64-bit
    • PROCESSOR: Intel Core i5 4th Gen or AMD equivalent
    • MEMORY: 12 GB RAM
    • GRAPHICS: NVIDIA GTX 1060 / AMD RX 580
    • DIRECTX: Version 11
    • STORAGE: 25 GB available space

RECOMMENDED:

      • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
      • OS: Windows 10/11 64-bit
      • PROCESSOR: Intel Core i7 or Ryzen 5 3600 and up
      • MEMORY: 16 GB RAM
      • GRAPHICS: NVIDIA RTX 2060 / AMD RX 5600
      • DIRECTX: Version 11

Ferocious will be priced at $24.99

Source: Steam



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/23/dinosaur-survival-fps-ferocious-is-launching-on-december-4th/

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 22/11/25
item.content:encoded:
I certainly wasn’t expecting to have been raining in Las Vegas when I belatedly got up and turned on the replay of the Formula 1 qualifying. I’m not silly enough to get up at 4AM for this time-shifted race, so enjoyed the mixed up conditions with daylight emerging, and now I’m rather looking forward to doing the same for the race tomorrow!

In the News This Week

Microsoft had an Xbox Partner Preview stream this week, which dished out a bunch of trailers and announcements to sink our teeth into.

  • Vampire Crawlers is a Vampire Survivors deckbuilding dungeon crawler coming out next year
  • Reanimal picks the most horrifying date possible for its February 2026 launch
  • Tales of Berseria Remastered announced, releases February 27th
  • Total Chaos is out now, the Doom mod rebuilt as a standalone survival horror
  • Ghost of Yōtei New Game Plus update arrives next week
  • Paradox and Colossal Order split – Cities: Skylines 2 development moves to Iceflake Studios
  • Beyond These Stars early access delayed to 2026
  • Nintendo shares first The Legend of Zelda live-action film still images
  • Bungie finally admit they messed up Destiny 2 and are going to make changes
  • F1 26 is a DLC – the next full F1 game will be in 2027
  • Sony gets Black Friday underway with £90 off a PS5

Games in Review & Featured Articles

Let’s start off with the reviews, as per usual.

  • Umami – PC – 9/10
  • Anno 117: Pax Romana – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater – Fox Hunt – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Monsters Are Coming! Rock & Road – PC – 8/10
  • Tomb Raider Definitive Edition – NSW2, NSW – 8/10
  • Kirby Air Riders – NSW2 – 7/10

We also had a couple hardware reviews for the Gioteck WX5+ controller and Corsair SABRE v2 Pro mouse.

Beyond that, Nic had the chance to sit down with Sohei Niikawa to talk Etrange Overlord and life after the board room.

Jason dove into the early access release of Moonlighter 2 for the first time, which is handling a jump across to 3D visuals and deeper combat. I went hands on with the puppet-tastic Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, which is shaping up really nicely, and Team Ninja’s latest soulslike in the form of Nioh 3. It’s going broader, and it has ninjas in it now!

Rounding out the week, What We Played featured Nioh 3, Ghost of Yotei & Monsters Are Coming!

Trailer Park

Raji: Kaliyuga announced, set six years after Raji: An Ancient Epic.

See a spectacular boss battle from Tides of Annihilation

Zoopunk is a sensational animal action adventure from the makers of FIST: Forged in Shadow Torch

Your Achievements

What have you been playing this week?

  • TSBonyman started playing Observation, and said it “feels like playing 2001 A Space Odyssey, but you take on the role of HAL”

That’s the round up for this week’s round up. Enjoy the weekend, and we’ll catch you for more gaming shenanigans next week!



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/22/something-for-the-weekend-22-11-25/
